page.title: 19HEALTH IN YATTON
page.content: Yatton has a modern health centre. From here, three doctors run a group practice. There are dentists and a chiropodist in the village. At Yatton Hall, mentally handicapped people are cared for. The adult patients are taught social skills with a view to eventually integrating them with the community. The policy of sending them out into the community has recently been accelerated, leading to much criticism and concern for their welfare. There is a special children's unit at Yatton Hall, dealing with both resident and non-resident patients. Villagers provide extra facilities through the Friends of Yatton Hall. Older residents of the village are cared for in sheltered accommodation run by the Methodists and the British Legion.
